fact: Did you know that walking or biking instead of driving can save about 1,600 pounds of carbon dioxide per year?
Recycling one aluminum can saves enough energy to run a TV for three hours!
Planting trees can help absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.
Using energy-efficient light bulbs can save you about $100 a year on electricity.
Eating less meat can reduce your carbon footprint significantly!
Taking shorter showers can save water and energy, reducing your carbon footprint.
Did you know that turning off lights when you leave a room can save energy?
Using reusable bags instead of plastic bags can help reduce waste and pollution.
Carpooling with friends can cut down on the number of cars on the road, reducing emissions.
Every little bit helps! Even small changes can make a big difference in reducing your carbon footprint.
